intro: Verbascum insulare, commonly known as the island mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, velvety leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. Verbascum insulare is adapted to the dry, sunny conditions of its native habitat.
